alert.note: Alert for Beartooth Foothills; Bighorn Canyon; Golden Valley; Judith Gap; Livingston Area; Melville Foothills; Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Carbon; Northern Park; Northern Stillwater; Northern Sweet Grass; Red Lodge Foothills; Southeastern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southern Wheatland; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 11:13AM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills occurring. Wind chills from 20 to 40 below zero at times. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana and north central Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Westerly winds will increase tonight and may cause local blowing and drifting snow into Tuesday. Areas most likely to be affected include I-90 from Livingston to Big Timber, and US-191 from Big Timber to Harlowton. Visibility may be reduced to under 2 miles at times. Local rural roads in the area running north to south may also see drifting. Drivers should use caution.
info.instruction: Persons are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Keep pets indoors as much as possible.
